summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from May 2018 regarding a camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It involves a SigNet Technologies sales representative and a DOJ/MCC communication technician discussing technical specifications, quotes, and coordination with the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP).

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.context: Sales representative for SigNet Technologies corresponding with a DOJ/MCC communication technician about providing a quote and technical details for a camera system upgrade at the MCC.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Program Manager for FBOP Contracts, involved in clarifying technical specifications about camera equipment for the MCC upgrade project.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding technical specifications and procurement for a camera system upgrade at the MCC, indicating a vendor-contractor or inter-agency coordination relationship.

events.title: Initial Camera List Sent
events.description: A DOJ/MCC communication technician sends a preliminary list of needed cameras for the MCC upgrade to Justin Houston and Steve Smith.

events.title: Technical Clarification on Cameras
events.description: Justin Houston clarifies that the Axis Q6000-E camera is not a PTZ camera and offers to change it on the list, following confusion among recipients.

events.title: Quote Coordination
events.description: A DOJ/MCC communication technician requests to be copied on the quote for the camera system upgrade.

events.title: Project Scope Confirmation
events.description: Steve Smith forwards a comprehensive project scope including a new NVR system, 272 cameras, installation, with conduit and network upgrades to be provided by FBOP.

keyFacts: The document details procurement and technical planning for a major security camera upgrade (272 cameras, new NVR system) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in May 2018.
The Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) was responsible for providing the conduit, cabling, and upgraded network infrastructure for the project.
Technical confusion arose regarding the Axis Q6000-E camera not being a PTZ (Pan-Tilt-Zoom) camera, requiring clarification and potential substitution.
The correspondence involves a DOJ/MCC communication technician, a SigNet Technologies sales representative, and an FBOP contracts program manager, showing inter-agency and vendor coordination.
The document is routine procurement/bid communication and does not directly reference Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any associated individuals.
